        Loads VaultEntries from a file using the NightscoutImporter.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file
        Returns:
        the loaded vault entries
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if the file does not exist, is a directory, cannot be read, or any other IOException occurs during execution

      • loadDataFromFile

        public static java.util.List<VaultEntry> loadDataFromFile(java.lang.String path,
                                                          boolean sort)
                                                   throws NightscoutIOException
        Loads VaultEntries from a file using the NightscoutImporter.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file
        sort - set to true to sort the resulting list by date
        Returns:
        the loaded vault entries
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if the file does not exist, is a directory, cannot be read, or any other IOException occurs during execution

      • loadDataFromFile

        public static java.util.List<VaultEntry> loadDataFromFile(java.lang.String path,
                                                          VaultEntryType type,
                                                          boolean sort)
                                                   throws NightscoutIOException
        Loads VaultEntries from a file using the NightscoutImporter.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file
        type - removes all entries that don't match this type. Set to null not remove any entries
        sort - set to true to sort the resulting list by date
        Returns:
        the loaded vault entries
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if the file does not exist, is a directory, cannot be read, or any other IOException occurs during execution

      • filterData

        public static java.util.List<VaultEntry> filterData(java.util.List<VaultEntry> data,
                                                    VaultEntryType type)
        Iterates over the list and returns a new list containing only entries with the given type. The order of the entries is kept.
        Parameters:
        data - a list auf vault entries
        type - the vault entry type that has to match each entry
        Returns:
        a list containing only entries matching the given type

      • filterData

        public static java.util.List<VaultEntry> filterData(java.util.List<VaultEntry> data,
                                                    java.util.Collection<VaultEntryType> types)
        Iterates over the list and returns a new list containing only entries with the given types. The order of the entries is kept.
        Parameters:
        data - a list auf vault entries
        types - the allowed vault entry types
        Returns:
        a list containing only entries matching the given type

      • writeDataToFile

        public static void writeDataToFile(java.lang.String path,
                                   java.util.List<VaultEntry> data)
                            throws NightscoutIOException
        Writes data to a file using the default NightscoutExporter. Does not overwrite existing files. Use writeDataToFile(String, List, boolean, NightscoutExporter) to overwrite existing files.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file
        data - data
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if the file is a directory, or already exists, or the file cannot be written to for any reason, or an exception occurs while writing to the file

      • writeDataToFile

        public static void writeDataToFile(java.lang.String path,
                                   java.util.List<VaultEntry> data,
                                   boolean overwrite,
                                   NightscoutExporter exporter)
                            throws NightscoutIOException
        Writes data to a file using the provided NightscoutExporter.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file
        data - data
        overwrite - whether or not to overwrite an existing file
        exporter - the exporter to use
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if the file is a directory, or already exists and overwrite is set to false, or the file cannot be written to for any reason, or an exception occurs while writing to the file

      • getZonedDateTime

        public static java.time.ZonedDateTime getZonedDateTime(java.lang.String value)
                                                throws NightscoutIOException
        Parses the given string as an iso date time. Applies any timezone information if possible, if no timezone is defined in the string it is treated as UTC time.
        Parameters:
        value - date and time string according to DateTimeFormatter.ISO_DATE_TIME
        Returns:
        object representing the given time
        Throws:
        NightscoutIOException - if the value cannot be parsed for any reason

      • split

        public static <T> java.util.List<java.util.List<T>> split(java.util.List<T> list,
                                                          int batchSize)
        Splits the list into multiple partitions. The Order is kept, so concatenating all partitions would result in the original list. Changes to the original list are not reflected in the partitions.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of objects in the list
        Parameters:
        list - list to split
        batchSize - maximum size of each partition
        Returns:
        list of partitions

      • split

        public static java.util.List<JsonArray> split(JsonArray array,
                                              int batchSize)
        Splits the array into multiple partitions. The Order is kept, so concatenating all partitions would result in the original array.
        Parameters:
        array - array to split
        batchSize - maximum size of each partition
        Returns:
        list of partitions

      • split

        public static <I extends java.lang.Iterable<T>,T> java.util.List<I> split(I list,
                                                                          int batchSize,
                                                                          java.util.function.Supplier<I> supplier,
                                                                          java.util.function.BiConsumer<I,T> consumer)
        Splits the list into multiple partitions. The Order is kept, so concatenating all partitions would result in the original list. Changes to the original list are not reflected in the partitions.
        Type Parameters:
        I - iterable
        T - type of objects in the iterable
        Parameters:
        list - list to split
        batchSize - maximum size of each partition
        supplier - a supplier for new partitions such as ArrayList.ArrayList()
        consumer - consumer that gets a partition and an object and adds the object to the partition such as List.add(E)
        Returns:
        list of partitions
